explanation: (of land or a building) to be next to something or to have one side touching the side of something
sentence: Mexico abuts (on) some of the richest parts of the United States.
sentence_gap: Mexico _____ (on) some of the richest parts of the United States.

explanation: formal; to consider or judge something in a particular way
sentence: We will provide help whenever you deem it appropriate.
sentence_gap: We will provide help whenever you ____ it appropriate.

explanation: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one that is done in order to receive a degree at college or university
sentence: This study was part of a doctoral dissertation.
sentence_gap: This study was part of a doctoral ____________.

explanation: to listen to someone's private conversation without them knowing
sentence: He was eavesdropping on our conversation.

explanation: to shine brightly with little flashes of light, like a diamond
sentence: The ceiling of the cathedral glittered with gold.
sentence_gap: The ceiling of the cathedral _________ with gold.

explanation: an imaginary line between the North Pole and the South Pole, drawn on maps to help to show the position of a place
sentence: The prime meridian of longitude is in Greenwich, London.
sentence_gap: The prime ________ of longitude is in Greenwich, London.

explanation: formal; to cause something to be needed, or to make something necessary
sentence: Reduction in government spending will necessitate further cuts in public services.
sentence_gap: Reduction in government spending will ___________ further cuts in public services.

explanation: a very small hole in the skin of people or other animals, or a similar hole on the surface of plants or rocks
sentence: Sweat passes through the pores and cools the body down.
sentence_gap: Sweat passes through the _____ and cools the body down.

explanation: to behave or feel toward someone in the same way as they behave or feel toward you
sentence: Her passion for him was not reciprocated.
sentence_gap: Her passion for him was not ____________.

explanation: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
sentence: I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave.
sentence_gap: I was having such a good time I was _________ to leave.

explanation: literary; (of a group of people) divided because of disagreements, especially in a violent way; (of an object) divided into two or more pieces
sentence: It was a community riven by hatred. The wood was riven with deep cracks.
sentence_gap: It was a community _____ by hatred. The wood was _____ with deep cracks.

explanation: to disturb the smooth surface of something, so that it is not even; to make someone annoyed, worried, or upset
sentence: She affectionately ruffled his hair with her hand as she passed.
sentence_gap: She affectionately _______ his hair with her hand as she passed.

explanation: the state of being very important and worth protecting
sentence: I believe in the sanctity of human life.
sentence_gap: I believe in the ________ of human life.

explanation: showing something that someone is trying to keep secret; showing that something exists or has happened
sentence: She was showing all the telltale signs of pregnancy. The telltale smell of cigarettes told her that he had been in the room.
sentence_gap: She was showing all the ________ signs of pregnancy. The ________ smell of cigarettes told her that he had been in the room.

explanation: formal; having all the necessary equipment; having comfortable and attractive furniture, etc.
sentence: The hotel has spacious, well-appointed public rooms and bedrooms.
sentence_gap: The hotel has spacious, ______________ public rooms and bedrooms.
